intro: Ancylobothrys brevituba, commonly known as the short-tubed ancylobothrys, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which split into two one-seeded parts when mature. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in woodland or grassy habitats. Ancylobothrys brevituba is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
